articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
To contact me, send an email to eer[at]eremrah.com.
I live in Ankara with my wife and our 4 cats (Badem, Alfred, Frida, and Duman).
I am a Research Assistant at Ankara University Economics Department.
I teach undergraduate statistics and data science courses.
My research interests include Agricultural Economics, Environmental Economics, and Applied Econometrics. I am a member of DigitalLab Mulkiye. I like coding in R and writing useless R packages.
You can find my CV here.

            I am a Research Assistant at Department of Economics, Ankara University.
            I teach undergraduate statistics and data science courses.
            My research interests include Agricultural Economics, Environmental Economics, and Applied Econometrics. I am a member of DigitalLab Mulkiye. I like coding in R and writing useless R packages.
            I live in Ankara with my wife and our 4 cats (Badem, Alfred, Frida, and Duman).

articles.title: R Packages
articles.contents:
Here are some R packages I wrote.
aqtr: Download Air Quality Data for Turkey
auobs: Interface to Ankara University OBS
cbRt: Interface to EDDS of CBRT
kgsr: Download Data from KGS
rnass: Interface to NASS Database
tbat: Download Data From the Banks Association of Turkey
tuik: Download TUIK Data
turkeymap: Provides City and District Data for Turkey
Farmland Values - Shiny App

articles.title: usesthis
articles.contents:
I like reading interviews on usesthis. From time to time my friends and colleagues also ask me what hardware and software I use. Here I tried to list them.
Hardware
MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2018) 2.9 GHz 6-Core Intel Core i9 32 GB 2400 MHz DDR4
Lenovo Thinkpad T420
Dell P2314H
2 Dell U2414H
Flexyarm 201 PRO BLACK Monitor Arm
Flexyarm 201 PRO BLACK LAPTOP Monitor Arm
StarTech.com Thunderbolt 3 Dock
Apple Magic Keyboard
Apple Magic Trackpad
OLKB Planck Keyboard
Logitech M570 Wireless Trackball Mouse
WA7 Fireflies Headphone Amplifier / DAC
Sennheiser HD650 Headphones
iPad Pro 10.5-inch
Software
Some of these software are important in my workflow. I tried to put together some scripts in a Github repo.
https://alternativeto.net/ is a great page to find alternative software.
You can also find lots of awesome software in #awesome. For example, for MacOS see this and for Windows see this.
Here is a list of software I use.
1Password
Alfred
AltTab
AppCleaner
Bartender
BetterTouchTool
BibDesk
BusyCal
Cyberduck

Firefox Developer Edition
